  1 require 'sass/constant/operation'
  2 require 'sass/constant/literal'
  3 
  4 module Sass
  5   module Constant # :nodoc:
  6     # The character that begins a constant.
  7     CONSTANT_CHAR   = ?!
  8 
  9     # Whitespace characters
 10     WHITESPACE = [?\ , ?\t, ?\n, ?\r]
 11   
 12     # The character used to escape values
 13     ESCAPE_CHAR = ?\\
 14 
 15     # The character used to open and close strings
 16     STRING_CHAR = ?"
 17     
 18     # A mapping of syntactically-significant characters
 19     # to parsed symbols
 20     SYMBOLS = {
 21       ?( => :open,
 22       ?) => :close,
 23       ?+ => :plus,
 24       ?- => :minus,
 25       ?* => :times,
 26       ?/ => :div,
 27       ?% => :mod,
 28       STRING_CHAR => :str,
 29       ESCAPE_CHAR => :esc
 30     }
 31 
 32     # The regular expression used to parse constants
 33     MATCH = /^#{Regexp.escape(CONSTANT_CHAR.chr)}([^\s#{(SYMBOLS.keys + [ ?= ]).map {|c| Regexp.escape("#{c.chr}") }}]+)\s*=\s*(.+)/
 34     
 35     # First-order operations
 36     FIRST_ORDER = [:times, :div, :mod]
 37     
 38     # Second-order operations
 39     SECOND_ORDER = [:plus, :minus]
 40   
 41     class << self
 42       def parse(value, constants, line)
 43         begin
 44           operationalize(parenthesize(tokenize(value)), constants).to_s
 45         rescue Sass::SyntaxError => e
 46           if e.message == "Constant arithmetic error"
 47             e.instance_eval do
 48               @message += ": #{value.dump}"
 49             end
 50           end
 51           e.sass_line = line
 52           raise e
 53         end
 54       end
 55       
 56       private
 57       
 58       def tokenize(value)
 59         escaped = false
 60         is_string = false
 61         negative_okay = true
 62         str = ''
 63         to_return = []
 64         
 65         reset_str = Proc.new do
 66           to_return << str unless str.empty?
 67           ''
 68         end
 69         
 70         value.each_byte do |byte|
 71           unless escaped
 72             if byte == ESCAPE_CHAR
 73               escaped = true
 74               next
 75             end
 76 
 77             last = to_return[-1]
 78 
 79             # Do we need to open or close a string literal?
 80             if byte == STRING_CHAR
 81               is_string = !is_string
 82 
 83               # Adjacent strings should be concatenated
 84               if is_string && last && (!last.is_a?(Symbol) || last == :close)
 85                 to_return << :concat
 86               end
 87 
 88               str = reset_str.call
 89               next
 90             end
 91 
 92             unless is_string
 93 
 94               # Are we looking at whitespace?
 95               if WHITESPACE.include?(byte)
 96                 str = reset_str.call
 97                 next
 98               end
 99             
100               symbol = SYMBOLS[byte]
101 
102               # Adjacent values without an operator should be concatenated
103               if (symbol.nil? || symbol == :open) &&
104                   last && (!last.is_a?(Symbol) || last == :close)
105                 to_return << :concat
106               end
107 
108               # Are we looking at an operator?
109               if symbol && !(negative_okay && symbol == :minus) &&
110                   (str.empty? || symbol != :mod)
111                 str = reset_str.call
112                 negative_okay = true
113                 to_return << symbol
114                 next
115               end
116             end
117           end
118           
119           escaped = false
120           negative_okay = false
121           str << byte.chr
122         end
123         
124         if is_string
125           raise Sass::SyntaxError.new("Unterminated string: #{value.dump}")
126         end
127         str = reset_str.call
128         to_return
129       end
130       
131       def parenthesize(value)
132         parenthesize_helper(0, value, value.length)[0]
133       end
134       
135       def parenthesize_helper(i, value, value_len)
136         to_return = []
137         beginning = i
138         token = value[i]
139         
140         while i < value_len && token != :close          
141           if token == :open
142             to_return.push(*value[beginning...i])
143             sub, i = parenthesize_helper(i + 1, value, value_len)
144             beginning = i
145             to_return << sub
146           else
147             i += 1
148           end
149           
150           token = value[i]
151         end
152         to_return.push(*value[beginning...i])
153         return to_return, i + 1
154       end
155       
156       #--
157       # TODO: Don't pass around original value;
158       #       have Constant.parse automatically add it to exception.
159       #++
160       def operationalize(value, constants)
161         value = [value] unless value.is_a?(Array)
162         length = value.length
163         if length == 1
164           value = value[0]
165           if value.is_a? Operation
166             value
167           else
168             Literal.parse(insert_constant(value, constants))
169           end
170         elsif length == 2
171           raise SyntaxError.new("Constant arithmetic error")
172         elsif length == 3
173           Operation.new(operationalize(value[0], constants), operationalize(value[2], constants), value[1])
174         else
175           if SECOND_ORDER.include?(value[1]) && FIRST_ORDER.include?(value[3])
176             operationalize([value[0], value[1], operationalize(value[2..4], constants), *value[5..-1]], constants)
177           else
178             operationalize([operationalize(value[0..2], constants), *value[3..-1]], constants)
179           end
180         end
181       end
182       
183       def insert_constant(value, constants)
184         to_return = value
185         if value[0] == CONSTANT_CHAR
186           to_return = constants[value[1..-1]]
187           unless to_return
188             raise SyntaxError.new("Undefined constant: \"#{value}\"")
189           end
190         end
191         to_return
192       end
193     end
194   end
195 end
